result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonja K. Gillespie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sonja K. Gillespie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sonja K. Gillespie was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.
State has submitted order. No objection by the Defense.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:00 AM Defendant Sonja K. Gillespie in court with Attorney Erin Nagy.  ADA Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1 as amended.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: Count 1 to Misd. Theft - 943.20(1)(a) Penalty - 943.20(3)(a)

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days in the Dane County Jail - Deemed Served

-Days credit for time served: 25 days credit
-Days credit to jail: 25 days credit

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
-V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Restitution: State has submitted Order, No objection by the Defense.

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H.

records.addlTxt: Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

03:09 PM Defendant in court, in custody from Iowa County Jail with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sonja K Gillespie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Atty Erin Nagy
Zoom
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to the next in-person court appearance or the conclusion of the case. 
- Defendant shall not be at Fleet Farm stores. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.
